Honestly, I feel that your relationship can improve much more, but itâ€™ll never fully, 100% fix.

Think of it this way: before you got an eating disorder, you still had times where you overate a little bit at Thanksgiving, right? You felt some guilt there, but it went away after like a day, and you just left it be.

Similarly to this, you gotta take it one day at a time. Donâ€™t look at â€œwhat about 20 years from nowâ€. No no no shhhhh. Just take baby steps. No baby could ever stand up and start walking the earth like that and going for 5 mile runs. No, they started off with moving their arms and legs, crawling, trying to stand up, standing up, trying to walk and maybe falling once or twice, and finally being able to walk. They then picked up skills to run.

Sorry for the weird analogy. My point is that after a while, you start to get accustomed to not throwing up, but you MUST take it one step at a time. Iâ€™m still learning this too. I still deal with BED and constant insecurities about myself and my body, but Iâ€™m starting off first with loving myself and treating myself right, then when thatâ€™s taken care of, then I take care of my binge eating and do things to forget about it. Then, I might try and look for some hobbies to distract me and make me feel good (for me, itâ€™s drawing right now). Then, I might look at my exercising habits and go at a good pace for it. Do you see me doing these things in 1 day? No, Iâ€™m going to be doing them one day at a time, starting now because Iâ€™ve been slipping a lot!

Her eating patterns and the amount of sugary and unhealthy foods she keeps around the house influence me a lot. She will literally eat half or a whole bag of chips/cheezits, in one sitting. She says that the unhealthy food in the house is for everyone else. Absolutely hate having to watch my family eat unhealthy food.

My mom has also said that she needs to lose weight, and then she says the same thing about my older brother and little brother, yet makes zero changes to the unhealthy foods seen in the house and makes zero efforts into trying something new. I donâ€™t think she gets how much it can influence you.

Honestly, Iâ€™m open about it to friends close to me, but not really with family. I feel like my family doesnâ€™t understand the severity of the situation, not to mention that my mom still buys so much unhealthy food too.

I know what itâ€™s like man. Iâ€™m only 17 and Iâ€™ve been dealing with this for over a year. And it happened after I lost weight too. I canâ€™t even find a balance and I donâ€™t even feel much enjoyment anymore. Feels like my whole life is going to be like this and I hate it. I hate it so much. Iâ€™ve never felt more weak in my life, and more ashamed. Itâ€™s as if itâ€™s going to haunt me forever.

I feel like when it starts to interfere with school/work and how you feel at school/work, then thatâ€™s when it becomes a major issue. Binge eating has really interferes with how I feel at school. Whenever it happens, I just feel like farting up a storm, while also feeling so bloated. Itâ€™s the worst feeling ever in a public setting.

Well, Iâ€™m a little upset because I binged a little yesterday and a lot today, but other than that, I stopped binge eating for 5 days straight. God, did it feel so good!!! To not have to feel bloated and miserable at school. To feel happy with myself.

I guess I let myself get a bit too comfortable. I have been doing better with eating in general (chewing 20-40 times and drinking water in between), but still.

I was also able to distract myself by doing drawing today, so I was able to get myself back into a hobby that I stopped doing before.

I hope I can just get to where I want to be. As much as it seems like Iâ€™m doing well and Iâ€™m less insecure, Iâ€™m still insecure about myself, though itâ€™s been lessening, itâ€™s still there, and Iâ€™m still scared, which is again lessening, but itâ€™s still there.
